issue.title: Deleting Cached Files on Mount that have been deleted on Remote returns an I/O Error

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Deleting Cached Files on Mount that have been deleted on Remote returns an I/O Error

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.52.2-209-gca3fbdef-vfs-beta
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.14.4
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux amd64-bit


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

N/A

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

N/A

body:
> As per my discussion with @ncw any files deleted from the remote aren't removed from the cache till the cache expiry runs which can be a couple of days now with the new vfs caching changes for the full mode.

Does the change notify not update the cache? I would have thought when you delete the file on the remote, the change notify should tell rclone and it will remove the file from the directory entry.

However If I use `--poll-interval 0` to turn off change notify I can replicate this problem.

What is happening is that a virtual directory entry gets made when you upload the file. The virtual entries normally get removed if you read the directory and the file is missing.

However if you don't read the directory and delete the remote file the virtual directory entry will remain indefinitely.

I have a potential fix for this but it doesn't work yet :-(

(sorry forgot to press send)

> Does the change notify not update the cache? I would have thought when you delete the file on the remote, the change notify should tell rclone and it will remove the file from the directory entry.

It doesn't seem to be removing cached files, only adding new files.

Just to clarify, this is not with files that were created and then uploaded, but instead with files that were downloaded/streamed via the mount. Not sure whether that makes a difference.

I use a 2 system setup (seedbox/plex) with rclone 1.53 and full cache. I am experiencing a similar issue when sonarr/radarr replaces a file that has been cached (analysis done by plex or playback) where it is not being removed from the cache on the Plex system. I am unsure if Plex had the file open at the time of the deletion but that is probable on some of the occurrences.
@ncw any word on updates to this?

Still experiencing ghost local files with `v1.53.1`, `Ubuntu focal 20.04 amd64`, `--vfs-cache-mode=full --dir-cache-time=1000h --polling-interval=15s --vfs-cache-max-age=300h`.

--

Checked it's happening intermittently. Not sure what's the cause.

Even if I queue a vfs/refresh for the directory containing the "ghost" file it does not get removed. Same result using vfs/forget. I assume both of those commands relate more to the directory caching and that I probably need to do something else to trigger a recheck for the file/folder itself that is specific to the cached file.

Maybe having rclone double check the cached entries when a refresh is done could be a way? I have no idea of the performance implications of such a "solution" though.

Adding this for reference as it's probably the same issue (but reversed): https://forum.rclone.org/t/missing-files-in-mount-but-present-on-remote/19399/10

I'll be patiently watching this :)

issue.title: Rclone VFS: Update for full cache mode

repository.name: Cloudbox
repository.description: Ansible-based solution for rapidly deploying a Docker containerized cloud media server.

issue.body:
Requires rclone >=1.53

Credit to darthShadow for example parameters

body:
I'm having the same issue on Rclone v1.53.2. If I delete a file on the remote externally (say via Google Drive web), the deleted file does not get removed from my VFS mount. However if I unmount and remount, the "ghost" files does disappear 

This does not always occur but seems to happen most often if you have very recently accessed a file via the VFS mount and then shortly thereafter delete it externally (via web). It will be stuck in your mount well past the default polling and dir-cache times (possibly forever). However if it's been a while (10+ mins in my testing) since you last accessed/cached the file on the VFS mount and then you delete it externally, it will almost immediately be removed from your mount (likely at first poll)

Here are all the options I use in case there is a conflict causing the issue:
```
  --user-agent='Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/74.0.3729.131 Safari/537.36' \
  --config=/var/lib/plexmediaserver/.config/rclone/rclone.conf \
  --allow-other \
  --vfs-cache-mode full \
  --vfs-cache-max-size 1200G \
  --vfs-cache-max-age 700h \
  --vfs-read-chunk-size=64M \
  --vfs-read-chunk-size-limit=1G \
  --vfs-read-ahead=64M \
  --umask=002 \
  --syslog \
  -v \
```

Here is a first attempt to fix this - testing appreciated :-)

[v1.54.0-beta.4887.226018dc2.fix-4446-vfs-virtual](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4446-vfs-virtual/v1.54.0-beta.4887.226018dc2.fix-4446-vfs-virtual/) on branch [fix-4446-vfs-virtual](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4446-vfs-virtual) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
@ncw Looks like the linux builds failed.

Here is a version with hopefully fixed linux builds. That was more complicated to fix than I thought!

[v1.54.0-beta.4889.45e8bea8d.fix-4446-vfs-virtual](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4446-vfs-virtual/v1.54.0-beta.4889.45e8bea8d.fix-4446-vfs-virtual/) on branch [fix-4446-vfs-virtual](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4446-vfs-virtual) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
From initial testing the items do indeed no longer appear in the directory but it would've been nice if they were also deleted when present in the local cache.

Thanks for testing.

The items will get expired from the cache when `--vfs-cache-max-age` or `--vfs-cache-max-size` is reached. This isn't ideal but dealing with the corner cases of the backend being modified while the vfs caching it is very hard!

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.54
The files were indeed gone when I woke up this morning. I can live with that as long as the rest works :)
